concept: pTX: Primary tumor cannot be assessed
pT0: No evidence of primary tumor
pTis: Urothelial carcinoma in situ: “flat tumor”
pT1: Tumor invades lamina propria (subepithelial connective tissue)
pT2a: Tumor invades superficial muscularis propria (inner half)
pT2b: Tumor invades deep muscularis propria (outer half)
pT3: Tumor invades perivesical soft tissue
pT3a: Tumor invades perivesical soft tissue microscopically
pT3b: Tumor invades perivesical soft tissue macroscopically (extravesical mass)
pT4: Extravesical tumor directly invades any of the following: prostatic stroma, seminal vesicles, uterus, vagina, pelvic wall, abdominal wall
pT4a: Extravesical tumor invades directly into prostatic stroma, uterus, or vagina
pT4b: Extravesical tumor invades pelvic wall, abdominal wall
pNX: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed
pN1: Single regional lymph node metastasis in the true pelvis (perivesical, obturator, internal and external iliac, or sacral lymph node)
pN2: Multiple regional lymph node metastasis in the true pelvis (perivesical, obturator, internal and external iliac, or sacral lymph node)
pN3: Lymph node metastasis to the common iliac lymph nodes
Not applicable - pM cannot be determined from the submitted specimen(s)
pM1a: Distant metastasis limited to lymph nodes beyond the common iliacs

parent: pM1c: Other site(s) with or without bone disease

concept: Papillary urothelial neoplasm, low malignant potential (PUNLMP)
Urothelial proliferation of uncertain malignant potential
Adenocarcinoma of prostate (use protocol for carcinoma of prostate)
